revised_title: The Energy Output of Labourers on Cold Storage Work: A Study of Physiological Cost
tldr: This study investigates the energy output and physiological cost of laborers working in cold storage, measuring the discharge of carbon dioxide. The research finds that cold storage work has a high fluctuation in energy output, with the load varying greatly depending on the amount of work done. The study concludes that the correlation between the physiological cost and the energy output is masked by the effects of work fluctuations.
